summary: My expertise is c-Si heterojunction solar cells, next generation thin (nanostructured) films for photovoltaics and for display technology, enhanced light coupling by plasmonics, nanophotonics, and photon conversion, 3D nanostructures such as quantum dots and nanowires/nanorods for solar cells, and hybrid tandem solar cells consisting of c-Si bottom cells and wide-bandgap thin film top cells (e.g., perovskite solar cells). Currently reconsidering my career path.

projects.title: Book about Cat-CVD, HWCVD, iCVD: Catalytic Chemical Vapor Deposition
projects.description: Hideki Matsumura (lead author), Hironobu Umemoto, Karen Gleason, and Ruud Schropp have embarked on a project to complete a book on CVD technology using heated filaments, known as Cat-CVD, Hot-Wire CVD, Hot-Filament CVD, and iCVD. The book aims to help engineers in industry to implement catalytic CVD thin film coating technologies and give researchers a comprehensive overview of the underlying physics and chemistry, as well as the state of the art of the technology. The book is due to appear in 2019.

company.name: ADEM Innovation Lab: A green Deal in Energy Materials

profile_positions.company: ADEM Innovation Lab: A green Deal in Energy Materials
profile_positions.description:
ADEM Innovation Lab is A green Deal in Energy Materials in which Industrial partners, ECN and the Universities of Technology of Delft, Eindhoven and Twente have joined forces in research on materials for conversion, storage, and transport of energy. The ADEM programme covers the themes of Wind, Storage, Batteries, Membranes, Solar cells and Fuel cells. For more information, please refer to the dedicated programme page (http://www.adem-innovationlab.nl/).
 
ADEM Innovation Lab strengthens the Dutch knowledge economy with joint expertise and an open and shared research infrastructure. The programme aims to materialise innovations in energy technologies in close collaboration with industry. For this reason, the Dutch Ministry of Economic Affairs supports this initiative with substantial funding.
 
Industrial partners can participate with cash or in-kind contributions of 10% or higher in ADEM’s research and make use of the shared research infrastructure (http://www.adem-innovationlab.nl/facilities/).
